Misconfigurations.Title: Image user should not be 'root'
Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify at least 1 USER command in Dockerfile with non-root user as argument
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: No HEALTHCHECK defined
Misconfigurations.Description: You should add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your docker container images to perform the health check on running containers.
Misconfigurations.Message: Add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: ConfigMap with sensitive content
Misconfigurations.Description: Storing sensitive content such as usernames and email addresses in configMaps is unsafe
Misconfigurations.Message: ConfigMap 'keycloak-config' in 'default' namespace stores sensitive contents in key(s) or value(s) '{"KC_DB_USERNAME", "KEYCLOAK_ADMIN"}'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove sensitive content from configMap data value

Misconfigurations.Title: Can elevate its own privileges
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all
Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs as root user
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ":latest" used
Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should specify an image tag
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'resources.requests.memory'

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'resources.limits.memory'

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with UID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with GID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'keycloak' of Deployment 'keycloak' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000

Misconfigurations.Title: Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.
Misconfigurations.Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'

Misconfigurations.Title: Seccomp policies disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Message: container "keycloak" of deployment "keycloak" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Title: Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE
Misconfigurations.Description: Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability.
Misconfigurations.Message: container should drop all
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Can elevate its own privileges
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hsco-keydb-container' of Deployment 'tts-dev-hsco-keydb' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false

Misconfigurations.Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'

Misconfigurations.Message: container "hsco-keydb-container" of deployment "tts-dev-hsco-keydb" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Message: container should drop all
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.

Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'hsco-nginx' should set 'resources.requests.memory'

Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'hsco-nginx' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000

Misconfigurations.Title: Specific capabilities added
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Capabilities', capabilities beyond the default set must not be added.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'hsco-nginx' should not set 'securityContext.capabilities.add'

Misconfigurations.Title: Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.
Misconfigurations.Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'

Misconfigurations.Title: Seccomp policies disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Message: container "nginx" of deployment "hsco-nginx" in "hsco" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Title: Containers must not set runAsUser to 0
Misconfigurations.Description: Containers should be forbidden from running with a root UID.
Misconfigurations.Message: securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a value greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'securityContext.runAsUser' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE
Misconfigurations.Description: Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability.
Misconfigurations.Message: container should drop all
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.

Misconfigurations.Title: ConfigMap with sensitive content
Misconfigurations.Description: Storing sensitive content such as usernames and email addresses in configMaps is unsafe
Misconfigurations.Message: ConfigMap 'openldap-config' in 'default' namespace stores sensitive contents in key(s) or value(s) '{"LDAPS_PORT", "LDAP_ADMIN_USERNAME", "LDAP_LOG_LEVEL", "LDAP_PORT"}'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove sensitive content from configMap data value

Misconfigurations.Title: ConfigMap with secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Storing secrets in configMaps is unsafe
Misconfigurations.Message: ConfigMap 'openldap-config' in 'default' namespace stores secrets in key(s) or value(s) '{"LDAP_CONFIG_PASSWORD"}'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove password/secret from configMap data value

Misconfigurations.Title: Can elevate its own privileges
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'openldap' of Deployment 'hsco-openldap' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all

Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'openldap' of Deployment 'hsco-openldap' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'openldap' of Deployment 'hsco-openldap' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'openldap' of Deployment 'hsco-openldap' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Workloads in the default namespace
Misconfigurations.Description: Checks whether a workload is running in the default namespace.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment hsco-openldap in default namespace should set metadata.namespace to a non-default namespace

Misconfigurations.Title: Prevent binding to privileged ports
Misconfigurations.Description: The ports which are lower than 1024 receive and transmit various sensitive and privileged data. Allowing containers to use them can bring serious implications.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment hsco-openldap in default namespace should not set spec.template.spec.containers.ports.containerPort to less than 1024
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not map the container ports to privileged host ports when starting a container.

Misconfigurations.Title: Can elevate its own privileges
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all
Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs as root user
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ":latest" used
Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should specify an image tag
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'resources.requests.memory'

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'resources.limits.memory'

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with UID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with GID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'postgres' of Deployment 'postgres' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.
Misconfigurations.Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay

Misconfigurations.Title: Seccomp policies disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Message: container "postgres" of deployment "postgres" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Title: Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE
Misconfigurations.Description: Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability.
Misconfigurations.Message: container should drop all
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.

Lines.Content: image: registry.teligenz.in/teligenz/teligenz_dev/images/postgres  # no tag here is okay
